change.item: Collection materials rehoused. Finding aid updated to reflect new extent and container listing. Arrangement note, processing information note, and scope and contents updated.

did.head: Overview of the Collection

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Xavier University Archives and Special Collections

did.physdesc: 26.5 linear feet (50 boxes, 1 map case drawer, 1 piece)
did.abstract: This is a collection consisting chiefly of correspondence from and to various Xavier presidents. Other materials may also be included, such as news clippings, texts of speeches, obituaries and school related materials generated during the presidency of an individual Xavier president. Holdings for individual Xavier presidents prior to 1940 are either minimal or non-existent.

bioghist.head: History of Xavier University Presidents
bioghist.p: Founded in 1841 as St. Xavier College by the Society of Jesus, Xavier changed its name to Xavier University in 1930. As of 2014, thirty-four Xavier administrations (not including two interim administrations) encompass the history of the institution.Two Xavier presidents served as president on two separate occasions, Thomas O'Neil, S.J. (1869-1871 and 1879) and Edward A. Higgins, S.J. (1874-1879 and 1885-1887). Two interim administrations saw the presidency of laymen (Dr. Frank Mastrianna (1986) and Mr. Michael Conaton (1990-1991). Otherwise Xavier presidents have been members of the Society of Jesus.

The following is a chronological listing of the presidents of Xavier University: 1840-47, John A. Elet, S.J.; 1847-48, John E. Blox, S.J.; 1849-51, John DeBlieck, S.J.; 1851-53, George A. Carrell, S.J.; 1853-56, Isidore Boudreaux, S.J.; 1856-61, Maurice Oakley, S.J.; 1861-65, John Schultz, S.J.; 1865-69, Walter H. Hill, S.J.; 1869-71, Thomas O'Neil, S.J.; 1871-74, Leopold Bushart, S.J.; 1874-79, Edward A. Higgins, S.J.; 1879, Thomas O'Neil, S.J.; 1879-81, Rudolph J. Meyer, S.J.; 1881-84, John I. Coghlan, S.J.; 1884-85, Henry Moeller, S.J.; 1885-87, Edward A. Higgins, S.J.; 1887-93, Henry Schapman, S.J.; 1893-97, Alexander J. Burrowes, S.J.; 1897-1901, Michael J. O'Connor, S.J.; 1901-08, Albert J. Dierckes, S.J.; 1908-11, Joseph Grimmelsman, S.J.; 1911-17, Francis Heiermann, S.J.; 1917-22, James McCabe, S.J.; 1923-31, Hubert F. Brockman, S.J.; 1931-35, Hugo F. Sloctemyer, S.J.; 1935-40, Dennis F. Burns, S.J.; 1940-49, Celestin J. Steiner, S.J.; 1949-55, James F. Maguire, S.J.; 1955-72, Paul L. O'Connor, S.J.; 1972-1982, Robert W. Mulligan, S.J.; 1982-85, Charles L. Currie, S.J.; 1986, Dr. Frank Mastrianna (interim); 1986-90, Albert J. DiUlio, S.J.; 1991, Mr. Michael Conaton (interim); 1991-2000, James E. Hoff, S.J.; 2000- , Michael J. Graham, S.J..

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This collection encompasses chiefly correspondence files of the various Xavier presidents. Included may be other materials including speeches, news clippings and files reflecting Xavier activities during the presidency of individual presidents. Many earlier Xavier presidents are either not represented in this collection or only minimally represented.

arrangement.head: Statement of Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged into three series: 19th century presidents, 20th century presidents, and 21st century presidents. Each president's papers are then arranged by type or topic and then chronologically.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Material
separatedmaterial.p: Photographs from James Hoff were separated and are unprocessed.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Correspondence from presidents Hubert Brockman and Hugo Sloctemeyer can also be found in Folder Fred Hilvert, Biographical Files Collection, Xavier University Archives, Xavier University, Cincinnati, Ohio.

Correspondence from presidents Hubert Brockman and Celestin Steiner can also be found in Folder Susanna Hinkle, Biographical Files Collection, Xavier University Archives, Xavier University, Cincinnati, Ohio.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: A 2017 rehousing project resulted in the consolidation of contents. Speeches were removed from original binders and placed in manuscript boxes. Boxes 38 and 44 no longer exist; contents have been moved to Box 37 (for Box 38) and Box 43 (for Box 44). Original intellectual order was maintained in the arrangement of the speeches.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: More current materials entail restricted access. Please contact the Xavier University Archives staff.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Box Number, Folder Number, XUA-50, President's Office records, Special Collections and University Archives, Xavier University Library, Cincinnati, Ohio.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Records include donation from Ernest Fontana, 2012 found in Box 7, Folder 4 (letters from Karl Wentersdorf to Paul O'Connor, 1970).

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Additions to this collection are expected.

controlaccess.head: Indexing Terms
controlaccess.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the library's online public access catalog.

did.unittitle: Contemporary Catholic Telegraph excerpts and biographical information

scopecontent.p: Information on St. Xavier College during the presidency of Fr. Maurice Oakley, including the collapse of the wall of St. Xavier Church and the resulting death of thirteen workmen. Also included is biographical information on Fr. Oakley. Seemingly some pages are missing.
Includes Fr. Heiermann's obituary.

separatedmaterial.p: Various awards of Fr. Paul L. O'Connor, S.J. can be found housed separately in the Xavier University Archives. A listing of awards is found with this separate collection. The box is labeled "XUA-50, President's Office records, Paul L. O'Connor Awards."

Various items from the office of Fr. Paul L. O'Connor, S.J. are also housed separately in the Xavier University Archives. A listing of box contents is included. The box is labeled "XUA-50, President's Office records, Personal Office Items."

separatedmaterial.p: Other items related to the Presidency of Fr. James E. Hoff, S.J. are housed separately in the Xavier University Archives.

Six oversized displays from the funeral ceremony of Fr. Hoff: four poster boards (45' x 30") on rubberized backing; one framed collage of pictures and personal items related to Fr. Hoff; one additional frame collage of Fr. Hoff images. These items are housed separately in the Archives Map Case labeled "XUA-50, President's Office Records, James E. Hoff Funeral Artifacts.". These items were displayed in St. Francis Xavier Church during the funeral celebration for Fr. Hoff. The poster boards were made by the Xavier University Special Events Office. The framed personal items of Fr. Hoff were given to the university by the Hoff Family.
The academic attire of Fr. Hoff is found separately housed in the Xavier University Archives and tagged "XUA-50, President's Office Records, James E. Hoff Academic Attire."

scopecontent.p: This box contains speech notes (and occasionally the typed speeches) of Xavier University President Fr. James Hoff, SJ. Speeches range from those given at academic awards ceremonies to end of the capital campaign in 2002. An index for each folder is included in folder 1.

arrangement.p: Speeches are arranged alphabetically by event or topic and then chronologically.
